qas.question: What did Henrich d'Arrest seek to find?

answers.text: the displacement characteristic of a planet

qas.question: How many degrees off was Adams' prediction?
What was Challis looking for when he saw Neptune the first two times?
Who urged Le Verrier to search with the observatory refractor?

plausible_answers.text: they could compare a recently drawn chart of the sky in the region of Le Verrier's predicted location with the current sky

qas.question: What did Galle suggest to Heinrich d'Arrest?
Who discovered Nepptune in the 18th century?
What was within 10 degrees of where Le Verrier predicted it would be?
What didn't Henrich d'Arrest seek to find?
What was Challis looking for when he saw Uranus the first two times?

context: Meanwhile, Le Verrier by letter urged Berlin Observatory astronomer <b5_0>Johann Gottfried Galle<b5_0/> to search with the observatory's refractor. Heinrich d'Arrest, a <a0_0>student at the observatory<a0_0/>, suggested to Galle that <b6_0>they could compare a recently drawn chart of the sky in the region of Le Verrier's predicted location with the current sky<b6_0/> to seek <a1_0>the <b11_0>displacement characteristic of a planet<b11_0/><a1_0/>, as opposed to a fixed star. On the evening of <a2_0><b9_0><b10_0>23 September 1846<b10_0/><b9_0/><a2_0/>, the day <b7_0>Galle<b7_0/> received the letter, he discovered <b8_0>Neptune<b8_0/> within 1° of where Le Verrier had predicted it to be, about <a3_0>12°<a3_0/> from <b12_0>Adams' prediction<b12_0/>. Challis later realised that he had observed the planet twice, on 4 and 12 August, but did not recognise it as a planet because he lacked an up-to-date star map and was distracted by his concurrent work on <a4_0><b13_0>comet observations<b13_0/><a4_0/>.
